meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get Moving!

I'm not going to sugarcoat it - I was all about the puns when I booted up Moving Out 2. And let me tell you, this game is a real treat for those of us who love a good chuckle. But enough about my terrible jokes; how does the game hold up under scrutiny?

First off, kudos to the critics for not entirely dismissing the sequel's reliance on puns and silly humor (looking at you, Slant Magazine). The chaotic adaptability they mentioned is spot-on - you'll find yourself laughing as much as getting frustrated with the game's constant surprises.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is it just more of the same old Moving Out formula?" Well, my friend, that depends on your perspective. If you're looking for a game that innovates on its predecessor and provides a fresh take on co-op play (hello, GamingTrend!), then yes, Moving Out 2 delivers.

But let's not forget the multiplayer aspect - after all, what's a Moving Out game without friends to share in the chaos? And it's here that the game truly shines, especially for those who've played the first installment. The level design has improved, and the new ideas are clever indeed (Metro GameCentral, you're speaking my language!).

Of course, not everyone will have as much fun as I did (ahem, Push Square, your 70% score was a bit low for me). But hey, that's what makes opinions so deliciously varied, right? Even the most skeptical of critics (TheSixthAxis, you're always good for some tough love) can't deny the game's charm when played with friends.

So, if you're looking for a silly, colorful co-op romp that's sure to bring the laughs and maybe even get a little frustrating (hello, GameGrin!), then Moving Out 2 is the way to go. And don't worry - I won't judge you if you play it just for the puns.
